flags.text: This project guide is not managed by MAKE staff.

guide.introduction:
I love the look of a vintage rotary phone and had a couple of them lying around begging to be brought back to life. In a fit of inspiration, I decided to marry form and

function. Thus the Retro Phone Phone Charging Station is born.
guide.introduction_rendered:
I love the look of a vintage rotary phone and had a couple of them lying around begging to be brought back to life. In a fit of inspiration, I decided to marry form and

function. Thus the Retro Phone Phone Charging Station is born.

lines.text: If you don't have a pretty rotary phone just begging to be transformed, a push button or other desktop phone will work. I see them at thrift stores and garage sales, and antique malls have them for around eight bucks.
lines.text_raw: If you don't have a pretty rotary phone just begging to be transformed, a push button or other desktop phone will work. I see them at thrift stores and garage sales, and antique malls have them for around eight bucks.

lines.text: Wall charger that matches you cell phone's jack
lines.text_raw: Wall charger that matches you cell phone's jack

lines.text: Any ol' car charger with a coiled cord
lines.text_raw: Any ol' car charger with a coiled cord

lines.text: First order of business is to take apart your phone. Carefully. And save the parts. The transformation is designed to create no damage to the old phone.
lines.text_raw: First order of business is to take apart your phone. Carefully. And save the parts. The transformation is designed to create no damage to the old phone.

lines.text: You know how well something is made by how easy it is to take apart, and this could not be more simple. Just keep turning the screwdriver and soon you will have all the room you need.
lines.text_raw: You know how well something is made by how easy it is to take apart, and this could not be more simple. Just keep turning the screwdriver and soon you will have all the room you need.

lines.text: Unscrew both caps on the hand set, remove the mic and speaker, and pull the original wiring out.
lines.text_raw: Unscrew both caps on the hand set, remove the mic and speaker, and pull the original wiring out.

lines.text: All we are doing here is using the coiled cord as an extension cord.
lines.text_raw: All we are doing here is using the coiled cord as an extension cord.

lines.text: Remove the stuff on both ends of the car charger and do with them what you will. Strip all of the wires.
lines.text_raw: Remove the stuff on both ends of the car charger and do with them what you will. Strip all of the wires.

lines.text: Cut the wall charger cord about half way, then strip its wires.
lines.text_raw: Cut the wall charger cord about half way, then strip its wires.

guide.summary: Turn your beautiful rotary phone into a very cool cell phone charger.
